第1回:
*All contents below subject to change, depending on needs and interests of the enrolled students.

Week 1: class overview, introductions, ice breakers
第2回: Week 2: Introduction Japanese / Canadian economies and tax systems, discussion of first 220-word journal (economics topic #1)
第3回: Week 3: The role of women in the Japanese economy, discussion of second 220-word journal (economics topic #2)
第4回: Week 4: Discussion of energy and homes in Japan, discussion of third 220-word journal (economics topic #3)
第5回: Week 5: Japanese and Canadian companies: an introduction, discussion of fourth 220-word journal (business topic #1)
第6回: Week 6: How Japanese companies advertise, introduction of final, discussion of fifth 220-word journal (business topic #2)
第7回: Week 7: Importing, exporting, and what makes a “good life”, discussion of sixth 220-word journal (business topic #3)
第8回: Week 8: The 2021 Olympics in Tokyo, discussion of seventh 220-word journal (hybrid topic #1)
第9回: Week 9: What are liberal political beliefs? Conservative beliefs? Discussion of eighth 220-word journal (politics topic #1)
第10回: Week 10: Should same-sex marriage be legal in Japan? Discussion of ninth 220-word journal (politics topic #2)
第11回: Week 11: Age of adulthood: smoking, drinking, and driving; discussion of final 220-word journal (politics topic #3)
トピック.授業外学習2: Each class will involve information and topics that will need to be applied to a final presentation. It is the students' responsibility to make notes during each class so they can successfully accomplish this. Also, a weekly journal of at least 220 words will be assigned. On average, this assignment should take one to two hours per week. You should have a stable wifi or internet connection at home to complete all out-of-class assignments.
